revised_title: Edwin Sherbon Hills: A Pioneering Geologist and Physiographer
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Edwin Sherbon Hills, a prominent Australian geologist and physiographer. It highlights his significant contributions to the fields of fossil fishes, acid vulcanism, and physiography, as well as his independent spirit and dedication to his work. Hills' research led to the reevaluation of the age of certain geological formations in Australia, and he was a mentor to many students who went on to become notable geologists themselves.
